If you have two or more languages installed you may enable the language switcher plugin and module. They should always be used together. If you create multilingual content and mark your content
'url': menu items or modules as being in specific languages and follow the complete instructions your users will be able to select a specific content language using the module. By default both the plugin and module are disabled.

'link_id': Joomla 2.5 installs with a language override manager that allows you to change the specific words (such as Edit or Search) used in the Joomla application.

There are a number of extensions that can help you manage translations of content available in the Joomla! Extensions Directory.

Here is where I will blog all about the parks of Australia.

'link_id': You can make a blog on your website by creating a category to write your blog posts in (this one is called Park Blog). Each blog post will be an article in that category. If you make a category blog menu link with 1 column it will look like this page

'link_id': To enhance your blog you may want to add extensions for comments

We search the whole countryside for the best fruit growers.

'link_id': You can let each supplier have a page that he or she can edit. To see this in action you will need to create a user who is in the suppliers group.

This illustrates the use of the Edit Own permission.

'description': 'Our directory of information about different kinds of fruit. We love fruit and want the world to know more about all of its many varieties. Although it is small now
'indexdate': we work on it whenever we have a chance. All of the images can be found in Wikimedia Comm'
column20:
'O:19:"FinderIndexerResult":19:{s:11:"�*�elements";a:19:{s:2:"id";s:2:"37";s:5:"alias";s:18:"fruit-encyclopedia";s:7:"summary";s:884:"

Our directory of information about different kinds of fruit.

We love fruit and want the world to know more about all of its many varieties.

Although it is small now
column21:
we work on it whenever we have a chance.

All of the images can be found in Wikimedia Commons.

This encyclopedia is implemented using the contact component
column22:
each fruit a separate contact and a category for each letter. A CSS style is used to create the horizontal layout of the alphabet headings.

If you wanted to
column23:
you could allow some users (such as your growers) to have access to just this category in the contact component and let them help you to create new content for the encyclopedia.

'description': 'Customers and suppliers can post their favorite recipes for fruit here. A good idea is to promote the use of metadata keywords to make finding other recipes for the same fruit easier. To see this in action
'indexdate': create a user assigned to the customer group and'
column20:
'O:19:"FinderIndexerResult":19:{s:11:"�*�elements";a:19:{s:2:"id";s:2:"76";s:5:"alias";s:7:"recipes";s:7:"summary";s:469:"

Customers and suppliers can post their favorite recipes for fruit here.

'link_id': A good idea is to promote the use of metadata keywords to make finding other recipes for the same fruit easier.

'link_id': <hr title="Menu Manager" alt="Menu Manager" class="system-pagebreak" style="color: gray; border: 1px dashed gray;" />
The menu manager lets you create the menus you see displayed on your site. It also allows you to assign modules and template styles to specific menu links. Help
<hr title="Global Configuration" alt="Global Configuration" class="system-pagebreak" style="color: gray; border: 1px dashed gray;" />
The global configuration is where the site administrator configures things such as whether search engine friendly urls are enabled
'url': the site meta data (descriptive text used by search engines and indexers) and other functions. For many beginning users simply leaving the settings on default is a good way to begin
'route': although when your site is ready for the public you will want to change the meta data to match its content. Help

'link_id': <hr title="Banners" alt="Banners" class="system-pagebreak" style="color: gray; border: 1px dashed gray;" />
The banners component provides a simple way to display a rotating image in a module and
'url': if you wish to have advertising
'route': a way to track the number of times an image is viewed and clicked. Help

'link_id':
The redirect component is used to manage broken links that produce Page Not Found (404) errors. If enabled it will allow you to redirect broken links to specific pages. It can also be used to manage migration related URL changes. Help

'O:19:"FinderIndexerResult":19:{s:11:"�*�elements";a:25:{s:2:"id";s:1:"8";s:5:"alias";s:9:"beginners";s:7:"summary";s:293:"

If this is your first Joomla! site or your first web site
column21: you have come to the right place. Joomla will help you get your website up and running quickly and easily.

'link_id': Start off using your site by logging in using the administrator account you created when you installed Joomla.
Explore the articles and other resources right here on your site data to learn more about how Joomla works. (When you\'re done reading
'url': you can delete or archive all of this.) You will also probably want to visit the Beginners\' Areas of the Joomla documentation and support forums.

'link_id': You\'ll also want to sign up for the Joomla Security Mailing list and the Announcements mailing list. For inspiration visit the Joomla! Site Showcase to see an amazing array of ways people use Joomla to tell their stories on the web.
The basic Joomla installation will let you get a great site up and running
'url': but when you are ready for more features the power of Joomla is in the creative ways that developers have extended it to do all kinds of things. Visit the Joomla! Extensions Directory to see thousands of extensions that can do almost anything you could want on a website. Can\'t find what you need? You may want to find a Joomla professional in the Joomla! Resource Directory.

'link_id':
Want to learn more? Consider attending a Joomla! Day or other event or joining a local Joomla! Users Group. Can\'t find one near you? Start one yourself.

Here\'s how to find our shop.

By car

Drive along Main Street to the intersection with First Avenue. Look for our sign.

By foot

From the center of town
column21:
walk north on Main Street until you see our sign.

By bus

Take the #73 Bus to the last stop. We are on the north east corner.

'O:19:"FinderIndexerResult":19:{s:11:"�*�elements";a:25:{s:2:"id";s:2:"20";s:5:"alias";s:10:"fruit-shop";s:7:"summary";s:858:"

Welcome to the Fruit Shop

'link_id': We sell fruits from around the world. Please use our website to learn more about our business. We hope you will come to our shop and buy some fruit.
This mini site will show you how you might want to set up a site for a business
'url': in this example one selling fruit. It shows how to use access controls to manage your site content. If you were building a real site
'route': you might want to extend it with e-commerce
'description': mailing lists or other enhancements
'indexdate': many of which are available through the Joomla! Extensions Directory.

'link_id':
To understand this site you will probably want to make one user with group set to customer and one with group set to grower. By logging in with different privileges you can see how access control works.

'description': 'It\'s easy to get started creating your website. Knowing some of the basics will help. What is a Content Management System? A content management system is software that allows you to create and manage webpages easily by separating the creation of your cont'
'object':
'O:19:"FinderIndexerResult":19:{s:11:"�*�elements";a:25:{s:2:"id";s:2:"22";s:5:"alias";s:15:"getting-started";s:7:"summary";s:2256:"

It\'s easy to get started creating your website. Knowing some of the basics will help.

'link_id': A content management system is software that allows you to create and manage webpages easily by separating the creation of your content from the mechanics required to present it on the web.

'url': the content is stored in a database. The look and feel are created by a template. The Joomla! software brings together the template and the content to create web pages.

'link_id': Your site actually has two separate sites. The site (also called the front end) is what visitors to your site will see. The administrator (also called the back end) is only used by people managing your site. You can access the administrator by clicking the "Site Administrator" link on the "This Site" menu or by adding /administrator to the end of you domain name.
Log in to the administrator using the username and password created during the installation of Joomla.

To login to the front end of your site use the login form or the login menu link on the "This Site" menu. Use the user name and password that were created as part of the installation process. Once logged-in you will be able to create and edit articles.

'url': you will be able to create content that only logged-in users are able to see.
a new menu will be visible. To create a new article
'route': click on the "submit article" link on that menu.

'link_id': The new article interface gives you a lot of options
'url': but all you need to do is add a title and put something in the content area. To make it easy to find
'route': set the state to published and put it in the Joomla category.

'link_id': You can edit an existing article by clicking on the edit icon (this only displays to users who have the right to edit).

There is much more to learn about how to use Joomla! to create the web site you envision. You can learn much more at the Joomla! documentation site and on the Joomla! forums.

The language switcher module allows you to take advantage of the language tags that are available when content
column21: modules and menu links are created.

'link_id': This module displays a list of available Content Languages for switching between them.

'url': it redirects to the Home page
'title': defined for the chosen language. Thereafter
'description': the navigation will be the one defined for that language.

'link_id': The language filter plugin must be enabled for this module to work properly.
To view an example of the language switch moduler module
'url':
go to the site administrator and enable the language filter plugin and the language switcher module labelled "language switcher" and visit the fruit shop or park sample sites. Then follow the instructions in this tutorial.

As you make your Joomla! site you will control the details of the display using options also referred to as parameters. Options control everything from whether the author\'s name is displayed to who can view what to the number of items shown on a list.

'link_id': Default options for each component are changed using the Options button on the component toolbar.
Options can also be set on an individual item
'url': such as an article or contact and in menu links.

'link_id': If you are happy with how your site looks
'url': it is fine to leave all of the options set to the defaults that were created when your site was installed. As you become more experienced with Joomla you will use options more.

'indexdate': the ability to control its look and the manag'
column20:
'O:19:"FinderIndexerResult":19:{s:11:"�*�elements";a:25:{s:2:"id";s:2:"35";s:5:"alias";s:13:"professionals";s:7:"summary";s:300:"

Joomla! 3 continues development of the Joomla Platform and CMS as a powerful and flexible way to bring your vision of the web to reality. With the new administrator interface and adoption of Twitter Bootstrap
column21: the ability to control its look and the management of extensions is now complete.

'link_id': Working with multiple template styles and overrides for the same views
'url': creating the design you want is easier than it has ever been. Limiting support to PHP 5.3.10 and above makes Joomla lighter and faster than ever.

'link_id': The separation of the Joomla! Platform project from the Joomla! CMS project makes continuous development of new
'url':
powerful APIs and continuous improvement of existing APIs possible while maintaining the stability of the CMS that millions of webmasters and professionals rely upon.

Your installation includes sample data
column21: designed to show you some of the options you have for building your website. In addition to information about Joomla! there are two sample "sites within a site" designed to help you get started with building your own site.

'link_id': The first site is a simple site about Australian Parks. It shows how you can quickly and easily build a personal site with just the building blocks that are part of Joomla. It includes a personal blog
'route': and a very simple image gallery.

'link_id': The second site is slightly more complex and represents what you might do if you are building a site for a small business
'url': in this case a Fruit Shop.

'route':
you will probably want to add extensions and either create or purchase your own template. Many Joomla users start by modifying the templates that come with the core distribution so that they include special images and other design elements that relate to their site\'s focus.

'description': 'Joomla! 2.5 offers two search options. The Basic Search component provides basic search functionality for the information contained in your core components. Many extensions can also be searched by the search component. Help The Smart Search component offe'

'link_id': The Basic Search component provides basic search functionality for the information contained in your core components. Many extensions can also be searched by the search component. Help
The Smart Search component offers searching similar to that found in major search engines. Smart Search is disabled by default. If you choose to enable it you will need to take several steps. First
'url': enable the Smart Search Plugin in the plugin manager. Then
'route': if you are using the Basic Search Module replace it with the Smart Search Module. Finally
'title': if you have already created content
'description': go to the Smart Search component in your site administrator and click the Index icon. Once indexing of your content is complete
'indexdate':
Smart Search will be ready to use. Help.

'description': 'The Joomla Project consists of all of the people who make and support the Joomla Web Platform and Content Management System. Our mission is to provide a flexible platform for digital publishing and collaboration. The core values are: Freedom Equality Trus'
'object':
'O:19:"FinderIndexerResult":19:{s:11:"�*�elements";a:25:{s:2:"id";s:2:"48";s:5:"alias";s:18:"the-joomla-project";s:7:"summary";s:1436:"

The Joomla Project consists of all of the people who make and support the Joomla Web Platform and Content Management System.

'link_id': Our mission is to provide a flexible platform for digital publishing and collaboration.
• People publishing and collaborating in their communities and around the world
• A community that is enjoyable and rewarding to participate in
• People around the world using their preferred languages
• A project dedicated to maintaining the trust of its users
There are millions of users around the world and thousands of people who contribute to the Joomla Project. They work in three main groups: the Production Working Group
'url': responsible for everything that goes into software and documentation; the Community Working Group
'route': responsible for creating a nurturing the community; and Open Source Matters
'title': the non profit organization responsible for managing legal
'description': financial and organizational issues.

'link_id': Joomla is a free and open source project
'url':
which uses the GNU General Public License version 2 or later.

'link_id': Two new plugins are available but are disabled by default.

• Contact Creator Help
    Creates a new linked contact record for each new user created.

• Profile Help
    This example profile plugin allows you to insert additional fields into user registration and profile display. This is intended as an example of the types of extensions to the profile you might want to create.

This article deliberately archived as an example.

As with previous releases
column21: Joomla! provides a unified and easy-to-use framework for delivering content for Web sites of all kinds. To support the changing nature of the Internet and emerging Web technologies
column22: Joomla! required substantial restructuring of its core functionality and we also used this effort to simplify many challenges within the current user interface. Joomla! 1.5 has many new features.

'route': and scalability far beyond the original Mambo foundations

'url': double-byte characters and right-to-left support for Arabic

'link_id': • Extended integration of external applications through Web services

'url': template and presentation capabilities to support accessibility standards and content delivery to any destination

'link_id': • A more sustainable and flexible framework for Component and Extension developers
<li>Backward compatibility with previous releases of Components
